tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 273 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck focuses on generating value through creatures like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer, while also utilizing Ephemerate to blink creatures and reuse powerful enter-the-battlefield effects. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining a steady stream of resources, this deck aims to outlast and outvalue its opponents in order to secure victory in a Pauper 1 vs 1 match.

The key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage through card draw and efficient creatures. With a focus on faeries and spells that disrupt opponent's strategies, this Dimir Control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining a strong board presence. Utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and ultimately outlast the opponent in a war of attrition.

The main idea behind this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, supported by a variety of combat tricks and pump spells. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Satyr Hoplite and Lagonna-Band Trailblazer to quickly apply pressure, while cards like Might of the Meek and Mutagenic Growth can further boost their power. Emerge Unscathed and Thraben Charm provide protection and removal options, while Ancestral Anger and Rile offer additional ways to deal damage. The mana base is designed to support a consistent and fast playstyle.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using sacrificial tactics and removal spells to outlast opponents. The deck utilizes cards like Cauldron Familiar and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm for recurring value, while utilizing cards like Pestilence and Eviscerator's Insight to wipe the board. With a mix of card draw, removal, and graveyard hate, the Golgari / Jund Garden control deck aims to grind out opponents while generating value through sacrificing creatures and controlling the board state.

The deck focuses on using Balustrade Spy to mill your own deck, putting creatures like Sagu Wildling and Lotleth Giant from your library into your graveyard. Once you have enough creatures in your graveyard, you can use Dread Return to reanimate a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant for a big finish. The deck also includes cards like Saruli Caretaker and Gatecreeper Vine to ramp and fix your mana, as well as other creatures for defense and card advantage. The goal is to quickly assemble your combo pieces and overwhelm your opponent.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to efficiently swarm the board with cheap creatures like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher, while disrupting opponent's strategy with removal spells like Cleansing Wildfire and Journey to Nowhere. The deck aims to maintain pressure by constantly attacking with efficient creatures and burning the opponent's life total with spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt. The mana base is optimized for quick plays and consistency, with a mix of basic lands and artifact lands to support the deck's synergy.

The key strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells and removing threats on the board with removal spells like Snuff Out and Cast Down. The deck aims to control the game through card advantage with cards like Augur of Bolas and Ninja of the Deep Hours, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Gurmag Angler. Additionally, the deck includes some card selection and filtering with Brainstorm and Preordain to ensure consistency in drawing relevant cards.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the Urzatron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) in combination with mana ramp cards (Chromatic Star, Expedition Map, Chromatic Sphere) to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful creatures like Maelstrom Colossus and Bramble Wurm. The deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Malevolent Rumble and generating card advantage with Ancient Stirrings. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and efficient mana usage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with creatures and then use Balustrade Spy along with Dread Return to combo off and win the game. The deck focuses on ramping up mana with creatures like Saruli Caretaker and Overgrown Battlement, while also utilizing cards like Land Grant and Lead the Stampede to quickly find combo pieces. The creatures in the deck also provide value and utility, such as Quirion Ranger for untapping lands and Masked Vandal for removal. Overall, the deck aims to execute its combo efficiently and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this Elves aggro deck is to quickly swarm the board with a combination of mana-producing creatures and powerful elves to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes creatures that can tap for mana, as well as cards that allow for card draw and searching for more elves. The strategy is to build a wide board presence and utilize pump effects like Timberwatch Elf to deal large amounts of damage in a short amount of time, aiming to win the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, creature sacrifice effects, and graveyard disruption. It utilizes cards like Crypt Rats, Cast Down, and Snuff Out to deal with threats on the board, while also generating value through cards like Ichor Wellspring and Writhing Chrysalis. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recurring creatures with Pulse of Murasa, creating token creatures with Khalni Garden, and gaining card advantage with Thorn of the Black Rose. Additionally, it disrupts the opponent's graveyard strategies with cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Bojuka Bog.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures, then reanimating them for powerful combos. By utilizing cards like Rubblebelt Maverick and Stinkweed Imp to dump creatures into the graveyard and then using cards like Dread Return and Scrapwork Mutt to bring them back, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a flood of creatures. The key strategy is to efficiently fill the graveyard while maintaining control of the board, setting up for explosive turns that can quickly lead to victory.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively build up your board with creatures like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter, supported by ramp cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl. Writhing Chrysalis and Eldrazi Repurposer provide additional threats, while Malevolent Rumble and Ram Through offer removal options. The overall strategy is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and powerful creature-based assault, supported by efficient ramp and removal spells to keep the pressure on and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining powerful creatures like Krark-Clan Shaman and Gixian Infiltrator with cards like Fanatical Offering and Cast Down, this deck can efficiently control the board and deal damage to the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Refurbished Familiar provide additional value and flexibility in combat. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence in order to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to create a fast-paced and aggressive strategy by utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells. By quickly building a board presence and dealing direct damage to the opponent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a defense. The deck includes a mix of creatures with abilities that provide additional value, along with instant damage spells to close out the game. Additionally, there are cards included to help replenish resources and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures with low mana costs, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient damage output. The deck utilizes burn spells like Galvanic Blast, Lightning Bolt, Fireblast, and Chain Lightning to finish off the opponent or deal with threats. The presence of cards like Clockwork Percussionist and Goblin Bushwhacker provide additional synergy and boost to the aggro strategy. Overall, the deck is designed to apply constant pressure and end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.
